title: KPDH History & Legends
description: The secret history of K-Pop demon hunting!

questions.question: Who was the legendary 'First Generation' hunter known as the 'Demon Queen'?

options.text: A solo vocalist who defeated 1000 demons
A dancer who invented choreography combat
A rapper who sealed the Hell Gate
A producer who created enchanted music

questions.explanation: The 'Demon Queen' was a first-gen solo hunter whose voice could paralyze demons. She's now a KPDH elder and trainer!

questions.question: The 'Hallyu Wave' was actually a massive supernatural barrier that protected Asia from demons.
questions.explanation: The global spread of K-Pop created a wave of protective fan energy that now shields much of the world from demon incursions!

questions.question: What was the 'Dark Era' in KPDH history?

options.text: When demons infiltrated the music industry
A period of no new recruits

questions.explanation: The Dark Era (2014-2016) saw demons secretly taking over entertainment companies. It took a massive coordinated effort to purge them!

questions.question: What ancient Korean tradition did KPDH adapt their training from?
questions.explanation: KPDH training combines modern performance with ancient Korean shamanic practices (굿/gut) - the original demon-fighting tradition!

questions.question: Music show wins actually seal demon portals in the broadcast area.
questions.explanation: Every music show trophy is enchanted. When a unit wins, the broadcast creates a temporary seal over demon portals in the viewing area!

questions.question: What is the 'Disbandment Protocol'?

options.text: When a group retires from hunting
Emergency separation to prevent unit possession

questions.explanation: If a demon targets a unit's bond, Disbandment Protocol separates members to prevent the demon from possessing the entire group!

questions.question: Where is the 'Archive of Sealed Demons' located?
questions.explanation: Jeju Island's volcanic caves house the Archive - defeated demons are sealed in enchanted albums stored deep underground!

questions.question: The term 'Stan' originally meant 'Supernatural Threat Assessment Network' member.
questions.explanation: Before it meant super-fan, 'Stan' was KPDH code for civilian supporters trained to report demon activity. Now it means both!
